definition: festival/holiday/node/joint/section/segment/part/to economize/to save/to abridge/moral integrity/classifier for segments, e.g. lessons, train wagons, biblical verses/CL:個|个[ge4]
see 節骨眼|节骨眼[jie1 gu5 yan3]
to pat/to clap/to slap/to swat/to take (a photo)/to shoot (a film)/racket (sports)/beat (music)

sentences.english: Metronomes should not be over used.
sentences.chinese: 節拍器也不應當被濫用。

sentences.english: A metronome might be used for this gradual speed-up.
sentences.chinese: 在慢慢增加速度的時候，節拍器也常被用到。
那節拍器擺動着顯示節拍。

sentences.english: GigBaby! four track recorder, metronome, drum machine.
sentences.chinese: 四軌錄音機，節拍器，鼓機。
節拍器能夠拯救你的生命。

sentences.english: If you're looking for a metronome, you've come to the wrong place.
sentences.chinese: 如果你在找一個節拍器，你已經走錯了地方了。

sentences.english: These vibrations turn the ion into a sort of superfast metronome.
sentences.chinese: 鋁離子因爲這些振動成爲一種超高速節拍器。

sentences.english: One double bass player likened the experience to being conducted by a metronome.
sentences.chinese: 一個大貝斯手將這段經歷比做被一個節拍器指揮。

sentences.english: Most teachers will check their students' tempi with it.
sentences.chinese: 大部分老師都會用節拍器來檢查他們學生的節奏。

definition: lit. to assess the head and discuss the feet (idiom); minute criticism of a woman's appearance/fig. to find fault in minor details/nitpicking/overcritical
to refute/to demolish (an argument, theory etc)
(idiom) to have one's words turn out to be (tragically) prophetic
(music) to change key/modulation/(of an employee) to be transferred to another post
